articles.title: Swiss mining giant Glencore in merger talks with Rio Tinto
articles.content: Swiss mining and commodity trading giant Glencore said Friday it is in merger talks with British-Australian rival Rio Tinto. The deal could proceed as an all-share merger, it said in a statement. Together, they would have a value of more than US$260 billion, the paper said. Glencore chief executive Gary Nagle in December outlined plans to become one of the world's largest copper producers. "Our portfolio, in particular in copper is world class," he told an investor presentation. "The coal business supports the energy needs of today as we...
